name: Incident Number
definition: Agency unique, in-house assigned case number
comment: The Incident Number should contain the current year as part of it when possible to prevent duplication/reuse of incident numbers across different years.

name: Incident Date/Hour
definition: Date and Time when the incident occurred or started, or at the beginning of the time period in which it occurred, or date of report if unknown

name: Cleared Exceptionally
definition: Indicates whether the incident was cleared exceptionally. Clearance of one offense clears the entire incident.
comment: For Code O (Other) - LIBRS Only, Does not clear NIBRS Incident

name: Exceptional Clearance Date
definition: When the incident was cleared, if cleared by exceptional means.

name: Offense Sequence Number
definition: Each Offense within the incident MUST be assigned a sequence number.
comment: Each Offense within an incident MUST be assigned a UNIQUE Offense Sequence Number.

name: Offense Sequence Number Reference
definition: **NEW** UNIQUE constraint that allows an Offense to relate to many Properties.
comment: Important: Internal system data element that allows for an Offense to relate to many properties where multiple Property/Offense segments are submitted within a single incident.

name: Louisiana Revised Statute Number (LRS Number)
definition: Each Offense (LRS) that occurred as part of the incident.
comment: MUST be in Master LIBRS/LRS Code Table to be accepted by LIBRS. Note: Contact LIBRS Program staff before adding new LRS codes to insure proper mappings.

name: Agency Supplied NIBRS Code
definition: NIBRS Code assigned to every Offense within an incident.
comment: Agencies should be aware that many Louisiana Revised Statutes map to multiple NIBRS codes. Please consult the LIBRS Master LRS Table to review these mappings and contact LIBRS Program Staff if you have questions.

name: Offense Attempted/Completed
definition: Indicates whether each Offense was completed or merely attempted.
comment: Agencies should be aware that many Louisiana Revised Statutes map to multiple NIBRS codes. Please consult the LIBRS Master LRS Table to review these mappings and contact LIBRS Program Staff if you have questions.

name: Offender Suspected of Using/Gaming Motivation
definition:
Indicates if the Offender was suspected of consuming alcohol or using drugs/narcotics during or shortly before the incident; or of using a computer to perpetrate the crime.

Also identifies whether the Offenderâ€™s gaming activity was the motive for commission of the crime.
comment:
This Data Element is located within Offender Segment.

Can enter up to four codes per Offender.

name: Bias Motivation/Bias Crime Type
definition: Indicates whether the Offender was motivated to commit the Offense because of his/her bias against a racial, religious, ethnic/national origin, sexual, or disability group.
comment: For Code O (Other) - LIBRS Only, Does not clear NIBRS Incident

name: Exceptional Clearance Date
definition: When the incident was cleared, if cleared by exceptional means.

name: Offense Sequence Number
definition: Each Offense within the incident MUST be assigned a sequence number
comment: Each Offense within an incident MUST be assigned a UNIQUE Offense Sequence Number
